sub_topic: Show that every subgroup of a cyclic group is cyclic.
message_1:
Let G = <27> be a cyclic group of order 54. Determine whether each of the following subgroups of G is cyclic:

a) H = <9>
 
b) K = <54> 

c) L = <18>
message_2:
To determine whether each of the subgroups is cyclic, we will check if the order of the generator of each subgroup divides the order of G.

a) H = <9>
The order of 9 in G is the smallest positive integer n such that 9^n is congruent to 1 modulo 54. We can calculate:

9^1 ≡ 9 (mod 54)
9^2 ≡ 81 ≡ 27 (mod 54)
9^3 ≡ 729 ≡ 1 (mod 54)

So, the order of 9 in G is 3. Since 3 divides 54, the subgroup H is cyclic.

b) K = <54>
The order of 54 in G is the smallest positive integer n such that 54^n is congruent to 1 modulo 54. However, since 54 is congruent to 0 modulo 54, there is no positive integer n such that 54^n is congruent to 1 modulo 54. Therefore, K is not a subgroup of G.

c) L = <18>
The order of 18 in G is the smallest positive integer n such that 18^n is congruent to 1 modulo 54. We can calculate:

18^1 ≡ 18 (mod 54)
18^2 ≡ 324 ≡ 18 (mod 54)
18^3 ≡ 5832 ≡ 1 (mod 54)

So, the order of 18 in G is 3. Since 3 divides 54, the subgroup L is cyclic.

In conclusion, H and L are cyclic subgroups of G, while K is not a subgroup of G.
